headline: Honeywell Q2 guidance, Wells Fargo buyback, Altria earnings
summary: Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including Honeywell's (HON) second quarter forecasts, Wells Fargo's (WFC) announcement of a $40 billion stock buyback program, and tobacco company Altria (MO) reported better-than-expected first quarter adjusted earnings results. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) Announces US$40 Billion Buyback and Confirms Dividend
summary: Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) recently announced a share repurchase program authorizing the buyback of up to $40 billion of its shares, alongside the approval of a $0.40 per share quarterly dividend. These decisions underline the company's focus on enhancing shareholder value. The stock saw a 8% price increase over the past week. Given that the broader market climbed 7%, these actions, while important, align more with the overall positive market trend spurred by strong earnings reports rather than...

headline: Wells Fargo investors approve executive pay as compliance fixes gain momentum
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Wells Fargo shareholders on Tuesday approved executive pay packages and the appointment of directors with strong majority support.  Most of the company's proposals received over 90% of shareholders' votes in favor of the motions while all the shareholder proposals were rejected.  On Tuesday, the bank also said its board had authorized a stock buyback program of up to $40 billion, which will take effect upon the completion of the current repurchase program, but ruled out any immediate plans for a stock split.

headline: Wells Fargo & Company Announces Common Stock Dividend and New $40 Billion Common Stock Repurchase Program
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, April 29, 2025--Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) today announced its board of directors approved a quarterly common stock dividend of $0.40 per share, payable June 1, 2025, to stockholders of record on May 9, 2025.
